My congratulations to US President-Elect @JoeBiden and Vice President-Elect @KamalaHarris on your historic #Election2020 win. #Ethiopia looks forward to working closely with you.

Ethiopiaâ€™s quest to have a successful transition towards constitutional democracy requires adherence to rule of law. The Government will continue to take necessary law enforcement measures to safeguard & advance our nascent process of democratization from rogue political actors.

Criminal elements cannot escape the rule of law under the guise of seeking reconciliation and a call for dialogue. Our operation aims to end the impunity that has prevailed for far too long and hold accountable individuals and groups under the laws of the land.

Ethiopia has no place for criminal elements. The proud Ethiopian people of Tigray & other citizens cannot be taken hostage by fugitives from justice forever. We shall extract the region of these criminal elements & relaunch our country on a path to sustainable prosperity for all.

Article 51 of FDRE Constitution, listing powers & functions of federal govâ€™t stipulates that â€œIt shall protect & defend the Constitutionâ€. To discharge this duty the govâ€™t is taking measures to enforce the rule of law against a clique that attacked our National Defense Forces.1/2

The Federal Gov patiently tried for several months to resolve differences with TPLF leadership peacefully; we tried mediation, reconciliation, dialogue. All failed b/c of TPLF criminal hubris & intransigence. In the last straw TPLF attacked the Northern Command based in Tigray2/2

Operations by federal defence forces underway in Northern #Ethiopia have clear, limited & achievable objectives â€” to restore the rule of law & the constitutional order, and to safeguard the rights of Ethiopians to lead a peaceful life wherever they are in the country.1/2

The Dire Dawa Industrial Park Project we inaugurated today sits on 150ha with 15 sheds in the first phase of industry development. It offers youth in the community the opportunity to grasp new skills and knowledge as well as demonstrate their productivity. 1/2 https://t.co/fq8k80SZVo
This will not only enable it to earn foreign exchange by using the vast livestock resources in the area, but also help create jobs for the local community. 2/2 https://t.co/4FwFVgxam9

On the outskirts of Dire Dawa, we inaugurated an abattoir that has been set up to export animal meat products. Built 5 km from Dire Dawa, the abattoir has the capacity to slaughter more than 100 camels and more than 3,000 sheep and goats per day.1/2 https://t.co/BOr3BUUm1L

On the other hand, we also saw wheat and other crops being grown on 100,000 hectares of land in the same Aw Barre woreda. Although progress of 30 quintals per hectare is a good start, it is necessary to increase the productivity in the future. 2/2 https://t.co/TGwst4Prp0
We visited the damage caused by the locust swarm in the Somali region. The swarm is now under control through chemical sprays administered with aircrafts. 1/2 https://t.co/seETEoWHzS

The remaining 56 km road from Jijiga to Gelelesh was completed at a cost of 1 billion birr and was inaugurated today. The road is of great importance as it is the main development corridor of the region.2/2 https://t.co/v69dcEnPL1

We also launched the construction of the 1.8 billion birr Gelelesh-Degehamdo road in the Somali region. This is part of a 166km long road project from Jijiga-Gelelesh-Degehamdo. 1/2 https://t.co/iV3TYpIhDD

Today we visited the Gode Irrigation Dam constructed on the Shebele River. Through the dam, 2,000 hectares of lowland wheat has been cultivated as part of lowland agriculture. In addition to wheat, vegetables, fruits, and oilseeds are also widely grown. https://t.co/ZBS4R0geZA
In addition to connecting local communities, the roads will enable market linkage and make Gode town a development center. 2/2 https://t.co/TCnGCUIpoA

Today we launched a road project of about 300 kms in the Somali regional state budgeted at more than 6 billion bore. The roads to be constructed include the Gode-Kelofo Lot-1, Gode-Hargele Lot and Yale-Dana Lot-3 construction projects to be completed within 4 years.1/2 https://t.co/hOHMqoCHht

It is true that our communities are faced with a myriad of problems which #COVID19 will exacerbate. Nevertheless, sustainable solutions also have the potential to emerge in such critical periods. I encourage all minds to engage in innovative pursuits in service to humanity.

Today we received the 3rd round of essential medical supplies from @JackMa including 199,300 protective clothing, 300 ventilators, 708 thermometer guns, 28,500 medical gloves and 3,800Â faces shields. Thanks you for continuing to show solidarity with #Africa. https://t.co/O1COAWx9WV

Let us use such moments as a catalyst for finding and acting upon a myriad of problems our communities face. From problem makers to solutions seekers! It is this way that we can progress into prosperity. 3/3

Through a reckoning of this interdependence, the experience has also shown us that faced with a common purpose, we have the ability to collectively overcome obstacles. That we have boundless creative abilities that can be manifested to problem solve. 2/3

The past weeks have shown us the extent of human vulnerability & fragility all around the world. They have shown us that in a single moment what we know to be certain can shift abruptly. That the extent of our survival as a global community is intertwined. 1/3

Encouraging phone call with @realDonaldTrump reconfirming continued US-Ethiopia relations. Appreciate the commitment of support to #COVID19 prevention and mitigation efforts as well as on desert locust control.

@WHO indicate that the virus will stay with us for a long time with the potential to re-ignite even where it seems successfully contained. Therefore, we should not be complacent and abandon the precautionary measures necessary to halt the spread. 2/2

One of the greatest threats to countering the spread of #COVID19 nationally, is complacency. While cases in the worst affected parts of the world are stable, most countries including ours are still in the early stages. 1/2

Good phone call with PM @AbeShinzo on how we can collaborate in addressing the #COVID19 crisis, particularly the economic and food security challenges that may arise as a result. Our conversation affirmed to me that #Africa has a strong ally post #TICAD and in times of crisis.
As insufficient public health measures can also prolong the economic crisis, we will also invest heavily in the health system as part of our economic responses. 3/3

Ensuring agricultural productivity is also critical to our food security. We will ensure uninterrupted supplies of fertilizers, improved seeds, pesticides to prevent any potential supply shortages. 2/3

To mitigate the adverse impact of #COVID19 on our economy, it is critical to take measures to protect employment and income; scale up safety net programs to the most vulnerable; maintain the supply chain of key commodities and support the productive sectors of the economy. 1/3

If we work collectively, the #COVID19 pandemic will come to pass. Of what we can overcome, we need not believe it will consume us. We will share what we have; we will crossover. Have no doubt that this too shall pass!

No one takes out what they do not already have. So is the heart. It receives what it gives out. To receive, one must first learn to give. We cannot be generous whilst thinking of losses. This is why we can only narrate tales of wealth to be prosperous,rather than that of poverty.
